organization.fullName: Bellus Health Inc. - a GSK company

identificationModule.briefTitle: A 24-Week Study of the Efficacy and Safety of BLU-5937 in Adults With Refractory Chronic Cough (CALM-2)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 3, 24-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Arm Efficacy and Safety Study With Open-Label Extension of BLU-5937 in Adult Participants With Refractory Chronic Cough, Including Unexplained Chronic Cough

leadSponsor.name: Bellus Health Inc. - a GSK company

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-arm, Phase 3 study of BLU-5937 in participants with Refractory Chronic Cough (RCC).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The primary efficacy objective is to assess the effect of BLU-5937 on 24-hour cough frequency in adults with refractory chronic cough (including unexplained chronic cough) at 24 weeks.

armGroups.label: BLU-5937 25 mg
armGroups.description: BLU-5937 oral dose 25 mg twice a day.

armGroups.label: BLU-5937 50 mg
armGroups.description: BLU-5937 oral dose 50 mg twice a day.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Matching Placebo for BLU-5937 oral dose twice a day.

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Oral administration of matching placebo for BLU-5937 Tablets

primaryOutcomes.description: Assessed using an ambulatory cough monitor

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Cough Severity Visual Analogue Scale at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed by Cough Severity Visual Analogue Scale \[VAS\] by the participant on a 100 mm visual analog scale where higher scores indicate greater severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With ≥ 30mm Reduction, ≥ 20mm Reduction From Baseline in Cough Severity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed by Cough Severity Visual Analogue Scale \[VAS\] by the participant on a 100 mm visual analog scale where higher scores indicate greater severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With ≥30%, ≥50%, and ≥70% Reduction From Baseline in 24-Hour Cough Frequency at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed using an ambulatory cough monitor

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in the Leicester Cough Questionnaire (LCQ) Total Score at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: The LCQ is a patient-reported quality of life (QOL) measure of chronic cough. The questionnaire consists of 19 items to which the patient responds on a 7-point Likert response scale (from 1 to 7). Each item assesses symptoms during cough and the impact of cough on 3 domains: physical, psychological, and social. Domain scores range from 1-7, and the total score ranges from 3 - 21; a higher score indicates a better quality of life.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥1.3-point Increase From Baseline in Leicester Cough Questionnaire (LCQ) Total Score at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: The LCQ is a patient-reported quality of life (QOL) measure of chronic cough. The questionnaire consists of 19 items to which the patient responds on a 7-point Likert response scale (from 1 to 7). Each item assesses symptoms during cough and the impact of cough on 3 domains: physical, psychological, and social. Domain scores range from 1-7, and the total score ranges from 3 - 21; a higher score indicates a better quality of life.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Capable of giving signed informed consent
* Refractory chronic cough (including unexplained chronic cough) for at least one year
* Women of child-bearing potential must use a highly effective contraception method during the study and for at least 14 days after the last dose

Exclusion Criteria:

* Current smoker/vaper (all forms of smoking and inhaled substances, including , cannabis/tobacco smoke and nicotine vapors) or individuals who have given up smoking within the past 6 months, or those with \>20 pack-year smoking history
* Diagnosis of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), bronchiectasis, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis or uncontrolled asthma
* Respiratory tract infection within 4 weeks before screening
* Laboratory confirmed Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection at screening
* History of malignancy in the last 5 years
* History of alcohol or drug abuse within the last 3 years
* Has a positive serologic test for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B virus surface antigen, or hepatitis C virus.
* Previous participation in a BLU-5937 trial
